result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tonya L. Malone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tonya L. Malone in court/custody with attorney H C Haukaas.  Charles J Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:18 pm Also calling 13CF204 and 14CF27. State Malone entering change of plea 14CF27 DRI as part of agreement. Haukaas makes statement the forms say NC however willing to plead guility to the counts. Will be asking for PSI with both sides free to argue. 13CF63 - plead to count 1, 3, 8, 10, 12, 14, 21, 22, 23, 25, 26, 27, 29, 30, 31, 34 all remaining counts DRI. 13CF204 - plead to count 1, 3 & 4 and count 2 DRI. 14CF27 DRI entirety. Defendant pleads guility to 13CF63 count 1, 3, 8, 10, 12, 14, 21, 22, 23, 25, 26, 27, 29, 30, 31 & 34. Court DRI all remaining counts. 13CF204 - defendant pleads guility to counts 1, 3 & 4 - court DRI count 2. Court goes thru plea questionnaire and finds that defendant is entering her pleas freely, voluntarily and intelligently by entering her plea and waiving her right to JT in all cases, factual basis, accepts pleas on all cases and adjudges guility of all counts which defendant has plead too. Orders PSI - on both cases. Haukaas makes arguement for bond. Family can come with approximately $3600 for bail. State concerned that defendant is here for sentencing state believe should be in lock down facility- state would be willing to stipulate to lock down facility if and when one becomes available and asks court to revoke bond on all cases and remand to jail. Haukaas responds not aware of any lock down facility. Court believes that defendant does need treatment would be willing to go to any treatment facility and may not leave the facility at all and if she would leave facility then she would be breaking her bond. State responds. Court will modify bond to include can go to any treatment facility, however if leaves treatment for any reason then would have to report back to jail immediately and if she doesn't would be further charges and total bond would be $3600 to be applied $500 to case 13CF63 and the remainder amount to case 14CF204. Atty Haukaas to draft paperwork for reduction of bond and state to approve before goes to Judge for signature. Until stipulation is filed regarding bond all bonds on both cases remain the same and are continuted. Adj.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Called at 3:00 PM. Also called 13CF204. Tonya Malone appears in person and in custody with attorney H.C. Haukass. State appears by Charles Simono. State - believe the PH is being waived on 14CF27 and probably just a status on 13CF204 as new counsel has recently been retained. Haukass and Malone agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed an Information that mirrors the complaint. Haukass has Information, waives reading, would like a different date for ARGN. Court continues bond on both cases, set 14CF27 for ARGN on 6/1/14 at 1:15 PM. On 13CF204 - Haukass does have discovery but needs time to go thru it with the defendant. Court sets that matter for  FPT on 6/18/14 at 1:15 PM.
Preliminary hearing on May 14, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
PH was rescheduled to 5/7/14 due to court congestion
Preliminary hearing on May 7, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 23, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Called at 4:09 PM. Also called 14CF27. Tonya Malone appears in person and in custody with attorney Brian Bennett. State appears by Charles Simono. On 14CF27 - Bennett has complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH within time limits but will waive time limits to 4/9/14 at 3:00 PM. Court continues bond, considers tine limits waived to 4/9/14, set for PH on 4/9/14 at 3:00 PM. On 13CF104 - Bennett - no real resolution yet, have made offer and counter offers, asks for an adjournment of FPT. State/Clerk - standard practice is to set for JT. Bennett responds. Court will set this matter for a FPT on 4/9/14 at 3:00 PM. Court continues bond on both cases.
Preliminary hearing on April 9, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
